intro: Gonostemon glabricaulis var. forcipis, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed gonostemon, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, smooth-stemmed structure and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, adapting to dry conditions with its succulent leaves. Its botanical interest lies in its unique morphology and limited distribution, making it a subject of study in botanical research. Due to its rarity, conservation efforts are important to protect this species from habitat loss.
